result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole Louise Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Provide DNA sample.  AODA/treatment per agent. Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Absolute Sobriety of alcohol and controlled substances.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicole Louise Perkins in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Nicole Louise Perkins in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and State states there is a joint recommendation.  Parties rec/rev revocation summary.  No objection to the documents.  State states recommendations are per the DOC recs.  Atty Masana is in agreement and makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on her own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE re: felony firearms warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

13CF405
5 years prison (3 years Initial Confinement + 2 years Extended Supervision)
Concurrent to sentence in 14CF406 - to commence FORTHWITH

14CF406
5 years prison (3 years Initial Confinement + 2 years Extended Supervision)
Concurrent to sentence in 13CF405

Conditions of extended supervision:
Not to possess any controlled substances w/o valid Rx and then only if used as prescribed
AODA/treatment per agent
Unpaid court obligations (costs/rest. et) to be paid as a condition of extended supervision
393 days credit to be applied to each case
DE is eligible for ERP and CIP
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 10, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicole Louise Perkins in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  State states recs/agreement.  Atty Masana agrees and parties waive prelim in 14CF406.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Atty Masana enters NC pleas per agreement.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty Masana makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on her own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised of felony firearms warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

13CF405
Ct 1:  NC
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in

14CF406
Ct 1:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 2:  NC

4 years probation on each count concurrent to each other
Conditions of probation:
Costs/surcharges of $518.00 x 2 and one $10.00 property crime surcharge in 13CF405 to be paid per agent
DNA sample to be provided  
Restitution/surcharges per stipulation
AODA/Treatment per agent
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances w/o a valid prescription and used as prescribed
Seek/maintain full-time employment/education
DE to report new status to P&P by 3pm on 2/10/2015

Offenses mentioned in restitution stipulation but not charged will remain uncharged
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on January 16, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Return date on February 13, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived. $500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today at Sheriff's Dept or Booking station.
